intro: Lycopersicon macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaf tomato, is a species native to South America. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, red fruits that resemble tomatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its botanical features include hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its edible fruits.
